intro: Tropidia eatonii, commonly known as the Eaton's twayblade, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the southeastern United States. It is a small, herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as pine forests and wetlands. The plant has a slender, leafless stem that produces a single, delicate flower with a greenish-white color and a distinctive hooded lip. Its roots form a symbiotic relationship with mycorrhizal fungi, which aid in nutrient absorption. Tropidia eatonii is often found in association with other orchids and is considered a rare and specialized species.
